text: It's a fairly good watch on it's own, but it loses some of the original's touch due to topsy-turvy Hollywood treatment.
low key wanna slip it inside lorax fr fr

I loved this film not just because of the great story line and the amusing characters but because of how enjoyable this movie is i could rewatch it 100x without getting bored . This movie shows the importance of the environment so well

Some of the most important movies in life.

I would often have concerns about movies depicting environment issues because soon, it may become too late for what they are talking about. But this, it goes down in history & is a timeless one, teaching you & encouraging you to take your first steps of doing a thing.

This is also an allegory of the economy vs the environment because the Onceler cut down all the Truffula trees which was a habitat for the animals there for his buggering business. The Onceler is no longer the antagonist due to his regrets later - which is what governments & companies who cannot get round to doing things for the environment should be feeling.

You know who I think the real hero is? Audrey (portrayed by Taylor Swift). She was the one who wanted to see a real tree & masking on her face how upset she is about what happened to the environment.

But, there a few nonsensical parts: how can those humans survive while they go outside despite the O'Hare products? What has the chemicalized water got to do with the not-so fresh air? Maybe it is the invisible pollution.

This should go down in history for its songs, loveable characters & memes more than the "Despicable Me" franchise.

The word UNLESS is a powerful one.

Illumination actually did matter. Its mt favourite movie of theirs & my favourite environmental movie.
Ok story with peak songs.
Good and nostalgic movie, and it teaches a good lesson to younger children

I love this! I have for years. I think the animation is great, the songs are catchy, and the story is really fun. I am honestly so surprised by the bad reviews this got. I thought they really brought the characters to life in a fun way. I think a lot of bad reviews came from people having a preconceived notion based upon the actors who voiced the characters, which is a shame.

This movie was amazing. I loved how it included real-world elements hidden throughout the story—they didn’t hold back with their creativity, and it was thrown right in your face in the best way.

Gleefully swimming in Hollywood bombast while providing an exploration of Dr. Seuss's timely themes that is content to go skin-deep, The Lorax amounts to little more than a messy agglomeration of silly musical numbers, ironically consumerist messaging, and highly derivative characterization.
Ok movie. Good songs, goofy villain, a little boring though.
